meanings.definition: An event causing great harm, damage, or suffering.
meanings.sent1: The earthquake brought many disasters to the city, leaving people homeless and injured.
meanings.sent2: The hurricane was one of the worst disasters the region had ever faced.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show turned into a disaster when the main act forgot all their lines.
meanings.sent4: Her failed attempt at baking a cake was a disaster, with smoke billowing from the oven.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used the science experiment gone wrong as an example of a disaster.

meanings.definition: A sudden accident or natural catastrophe that causes widespread destruction.
meanings.sent1: The tornado was a disaster that destroyed many homes in its path.
meanings.sent2: The forest fire was a natural disaster that ravaged the entire area.
meanings.sent3: The picnic turned into a disaster when it started raining heavily.
meanings.sent4: The financial crisis was a disaster for many families who lost their savings.
meanings.sent5: The volcanic eruption was a disaster that changed the landscape forever.
